column7: This license was found on the "charter" texlive 2010 component. It is a Free font license, GPL compatible.
This Font license is Free, but GPL-incompatible.

This license was found on the "ec" component in TeXLive. Originally, it was non-free, but the copyright holders agreed to drop a clause requiring distribution of the "unmodified fonts" in the event of modification. Even with this change, this license is considered to be on the "borderline" of Free, and it is not recommended for use.
This license was found on the "elvish" component in texlive 2010. It is a Font License, Free but GPL-incompatible.

column5: not found currently in Fedora - note this Fedora id is used for two different licenses?

column7: The Hack Open Font License is a weird mix of the Bitstream Vera and SIL Open Font licenses. It has the common "must be renamed if modified" and "must not be sold by itself" clauses that are found in font licenses. These clauses might make a software license non-free (though, the first one seems to be acceptable by the FSF in some cases), but they have been considered acceptable for FOSS font licensing for some time now. It is worth noting that the Hack font upstream (the origination of this license) feels that the "sold by itself" clause can be trivially circumvented and has no issue with people doing that (e.g. font comes with a helloworld binary).

While this license is Free (barely), it is not GPL compatible. This means that like Bitstream Vera, you cannot take a font under the IPA license and make a derived work which is under the GPL (or vice versa).

column7: The permission to modify is implicit here.

This is a variant of the Bitstream Vera font license. It has a few minor changes, specifically, the Bitstream Vera license included a note at the end, after the ALL CAPS section, about the use of certain names in advertising which the MgOpen license does not have, and the MgOpen license includes one additional phrase in the third paragraph:    "or if the modifications are accepted for inclusion in the Font   Software itself by the each appointed Administrator." This license was found at: http://www.ellak.gr/fonts/mgopen/index.en.html#license

column7: This license is a derived OFL license from the Russian Foundry "ParaType". First noticed on the "PT Sans" font. It is Free. Please note that the license refers to itself as the "Free Font License Agreement".
Esta licença de fonte é Livre, mas apenas como uma licença de fonte. Ela foi encontrada em no componente "punknova" no CTAN, também em TeXLive.
